bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, Emilie Lawrence Reed, and Blossom Reed, October 23, 1898

div1.p: Lawrence Reed expresses his feelings about leaving Camp Onward. He will make lieutenant in a year.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, Emilie Lawrence Reed, and Blossom Reed, October 23, 1898
div1.p:
I got here this
morning after a most
pleasant trip and find
Warren the same-- except
it is rather cold here.
Am sorry I could not
have staid home for
a year or so but
we dont get all we
want on this earth.
Am a little blue after
leaving her and you all
but when I think for
a moment and remember
that in two years I
will be Lieut Reedy of
The Guards I feel like a
diamond ring on the most beautiful woman
(say, Bess.). Am sorry I havent more
time to write but have been busy fixing
things since I got back. Had a nice
time in New York. I think my vaccination
is going to take, it feels that way.
Will write soon again. Love to all
and just tell them that you saw me
but that you don't do it now -- any more
I am like Dewolf Hopper, when he says, “And
then I woke up.”
Best love to all from your aff L-
